content:
Verizon sure turned that into a dogs breakfast before wandering off into the sunset.

Fundamentally the POP setting are on the AOL site, but they don't appear to line up real well with the need for a special password. https://help.aol.com/articles/how-do-i-set-up-other-email-applications-to-send-and-receive-my-verizon-net-mail

However I used the windows power shell to check out the route to the server for both the name given for Verizon and for AOL account holders and they actually map to exactly the same server.

PS C:\Users\Matt> tracert pop.verizon.net Tracing route to any-jpop-aol.mail.gm0.yahoodns.net [67.195.12.24]

PS C:\Users\Matt> tracert pop.aol.com Tracing route to any-jpop-aol.mail.gm0.yahoodns.net [67.195.12.24]
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
re :Account was performing normally but stopped downloading new messages.

You do not mention whether you had any error messages. Do you get any error messages ? If yes, post that information word for word or post images of error message.

If nothing happens at all - acting like maybe servers are down - please check to see if Thunderbird is not being blocked by Firewall.

  • Exit Thunderbird
  • Access Firewall - it may be part of your Anti-Virus product.
  • The Thunderbird program must be set up as an allowed program otherwise the firewall will block access and you will not be able to connect with servers.
  • Confim thunderbird.exe is set up as allowed program.

Please post info about your current setup: In Thunderbird

  • Help > More TRoubleshooting Information
  • Scroll to 'Mail and News Settings'
  • Either copy all the data in that area and paste it OR better - post an image showing all the data.

Maybe you need to get correct password: AOL may require you to use an app generated password. Do you normally use an app generated password ?

  • https://help.aol.com/articles/Create-and-manage-app-password?

Have you switched on 2 step verification and created an app generated password ? If yes then this is where you enter it:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to Passwords section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'Show Passwords'

Pop uses two lines: mailbox://... and smtp://.... Imap uses two lines: imap://... and smtp://....

  • Right click on each relevant line and select 'Edit Password'
  • clear all the contents and then enter the app generated password.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
What SMTP settings are you using for that mail account? Either access Account Settings > Outgoing Server SMTP select the smtp used for atlanticbb Post image showing setting. OR Help > More Troubleshooting Information Scroll to 'Mail and News Settings Post image showing that area.

TRying to locate info but so far located this insecure set up which I'm sure is rather old and there must be newer settings these days.

  • Server name: mail.atlanticbb.net
  • Port: 25
  • Username: [your name]@atlanticbb.net
  • Authentication method: Password, transmitted insecurely
  • Connection Security: None

But I also found these secure settings:

  • SMTP server name: smtp.atlanticbb.net
  • IF Port: 465
  • Then Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • IF Port: 587
  • Then Connection Secrity: STARTLS
  • User name: full alanticbb.net email address
  • Password - same one you use to logon to webmail account

content:
peter752 said
if I could permanently delete those files and directories, it would get rid of the phantom folder but I don't see how to do it.

Start by putting your file manager away. When things are automated like IMAP sync is, banging around manually deleting files and folders is generally a complete waste of time. I know, not the Linux way, but that is how it is.

Open account settings and click on the advanced button in server settings. In the IMAP server directory put / or perhaps [Email folders] depending if that is the server directory holding account folders.

Save your way out of there. click into another account and back, or restart Thunderbird and I think the folder will disappear as the disabled / is usually the server directory for folders. (in the case of gmail is is [Gmail] which also shows up in the Thunderbird interface if this setting is not manually set.)

You might also want to correct the folder names in account settings > Server settings and > junk to the folder names use on the server so you only have one of each.

content:
Kedves László!

A hibaüzenet alapján egyértelműen arról van szó, hogy hibásan vannak megadva a SPF/DKIM/DMARC beállításai. Az látom, hogy ezeket be vannak állítva, és nyilvánvaló problémát sem látok bennük, így én a tárhelyszolgáltatót kérdezném meg, hogy mi lehet a baj.

Tippre azért az lehet gond, hogy nem szerepel az mx az SPF rekordban. Ez a mostani: 

   v=spf1 ip4:192.168.0.1 include:spf.unas.eu ~all

Én átírnám erre: 

   v=spf1 +mx ip4:192.168.0.1 include:spf.unas.eu ~all

Illetve az a helyi IPv4-cím is furcsa nekem a rekordban, annak nem látom értelmét.

Szakértő egyébként egyáltalán nem vagyok, de van egy domainem, ahol működik a levelezés.

Üdv, Balázs
creator: meskobalazs

creator: @next

content:
Ho seguito le procedure consigliate. 1) I messaggi "riapparsi" dopo la correzione della cartella, sono stati salvati correttamente sul disco. 2) I messaggi sono stati trascinati sulla cartella di posta in entrata ma non comparivano ancora nell'elenco delle mail.


Proverò a 1) esportare tutti i messaggi in formato eml (per ulteriore backup) 2) creare un nuovo utente o una cartella archivio per spostarvi tutti i messaggi dalla posta in entrata. 3) cancellare tutti i messaggi dalla posta in entrata (con aggiornamento anche del server per evitare la duplicazione di messaggi in entrata a seguito di successivo invia e ricevi) 4) compattare la cartella 5) spostare i messaggi dalla cartella archivio / nuovo utente alla posta in arrivo...

Spero che in tal modo si rigeneri l'intero indice della posta in arrivo. In caso contrario salverò anche la posta inviata in un nuovo account e cancellerò il precedente.
creator: v.cefola

content:
Quando recuperi un messaggio, salvalo sul disco con la combinazione di tasti Ctrl + S o andando in Tasto menu > Salva con nome > File (o qualcosa di simile a seconda della versione)

Scegli il formato .eml per il salvataggio.

Successivamente, se il messaggio scompare nuovamente, trascina e rilascia il file eml salvato sulla cartella di Thunderbird in cui vuoi che il messaggio sia collocato.

Più in generale però la corruzione degli archivi di posta non è un buon segno. Assicurati che il tuo antivirus non sia la causa di questo problema (spesso lo è...). Ed assicurati anche di fare copie di backup con opportuna frequenza -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

content:
Is this a Pop mail account? It sounds like the 'popstate.dat' file got deleted or renamed or was corrupted and a new one created.

'popstate.dat' file keeps a record of all emails download so it does not download again. In your case, it sounds like a new one was created for some unknown reason and therefore Thunderbird had no knowledge on what had been previously download. It contacted server Inbox and downloaded everything that was in the server Inbox.

This would mean you see emails you had moved to other folders or deleted and never deleted off the server etc.

One of the main reasons for a popstate.dat file being recreated is caused by the Anti-Virus program. Maybe your anti-virus had tried to scan the 'popstate.dat' file and tried to fix it and ended up corrupting it or deleted it.

I have set my Anti-Virus to never scan the Thunderbird profile folders or it's files etc. I have never had a problem.

In pop account, Account Settings > Server Settings have you selected to delete off server when you delete emails? Do you compact the Inbox on a regular basis? Sometimes I've discovered you need to do that before it is properly removed off server.

Another method which is useful is to logon to webmail account and create a folder, then move all emails which have been downloaded out of the Inbox and into that newly created folder. This means if you get an issue with 'popstate.dat', it will not download all those emails because they are not in the Inbox. It also means if you need to get a full download for some reason, you can put emails back in Inbox, delete the popstate.dat file (must exit Thunderbird before you do that) and get a fresh download.

This will not help you sort out stuff but it will help to prevent an unwanted mass download if some thing goes wrong in the future.

The popstate.dat file is stored in the pop mail account name folder in profile:

  • C://Users/<User name>/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles/<profile name>/Mail/<pop account name>

You could check that location to see if there is more than one 'popstate.dat' file, maybe one with a number. Example image below.

You could also check your Anti-Virus to see if it quarrantined anything. Although if it tried to do something to that popstate.dat file, it would have just got corrupted.
creator: Toad-Hall
